title: How to fill intervals under KDE curve with different colors
Description: The intended visualization is a density plot using Seaborn's `kdeplot`, with colored areas filled under the curve. The area for the interval \( x < 0 \) should be filled with one color, and the area for \( x \geq 0 \) should be filled with a different color. The current graph only displays a black line representing the density without any filled areas. The expected graph shows two distinct colored regions beneath the density curve, clearly differentiating the intervals with the respective colors.
